m3p3Kvp3SvmiIVby6nY9FA.text: I was here on a Sunday afternoon while staying in the hotel. Since brunch is popular I would have expected the place to be buzzing but it's quite dead. I got a gin and tonic and a French onion soup. The reason I give this place only 3 stars is because the onion soup is just very blend any led tasteless why it can't be that difficult to make a tasty onion soup. My drink is ok and the staff is correct but not overly friendly. You don't have to come here for the atmosphere on a Sunday at 12.30 pm, that's for sure.

EqOJhx9Tr-JP8fPM3peC-A.text: My first visit after it changed from Habitat to Floor 2. Since its in the same space it still overall feels the same but I am a fan, has an open kitchen you can see from the dining room. Service is still good, but a bit inconsistent; very quick service when I sat down and ordered, but went a good 15 minutes after receiving food with no one checking in on us. Main course (family size fish) and sides were delicious. Bread and butter is an extra $4, a little bit nit picky for an expensive restaurant to begin with. My $10 drink was almost all ice, so was not impressed with that, and the desserts were bland and very small portion size.   So a solid 4* in my book with the food being delicious and service being generally good. If you want a drink, just get a glass of wine; their cocktails are overpriced and watered down. And go get dessert at the MilkShake Factory a couple blocks down; much cheaper and you'll enjoy it much better. :)

qEjA1gZTm5xrygb08nOPGA.text: I went to Fl 2 during summer restaurant week and will definitely be back. My husband ordered from the $35 restaurant week menu which included a poblano soup (simple but great flavor), lamb neck bolognese (he loved the spiciness of the lamb), and japanese cheesecake with matcha and cherry preserves (more of an angel cake consistently but very tasty and different). I decided to order from the traditional menu and started with the ratatouille (full of perfectly cooked veggies and a delicious sauce) and the octopus with lentils (the octopus was slightly overcooked but the lentils were amazing- maybe the best I've ever had!). The server was excellent and very accommodating and made excellent drink suggestions.  All of the cocktails sounded super interested and I ended up with the Lunch with Joe which was a smoked drink. They bring the class upsidedown with the smoke in it and then flip it over to pour in the prosecco mixture. The presentation was really cool and the drink was very tasty.

XrOjTTuCdyLuPDsJ5UBIgQ.text: The food here is a solid four. Our service, while friendly, was legitimately abysmal. We started the evening while standing at the host desk for several minutes while a hotel guest, who seemed to be flirting with him,  asked the host dozens of questions about the place - the host noticed us but at no point made an effort to acknowledge us or say he'd be with us in a moment. Another staff member came up, saw us waiting, and also ignored us. Seated, our server took our drink orders, then came back, said our drinks would be right up, and wanted to take our orders. We had a few questions and wanted to confer, so we asked her to come back. She came back ten minutes later, still not bringing us our drinks, and said she was ready to take our order. Again, we inquired about our drinks, and she again said they would be right up. We ordered, and she headed to the POS to put in our order - still no drinks. Finally got our cocktails (VERY GOOD)  about 20 minutes after were were seated and were left no time to enjoy them because our apps were dropped soon after. Tartare and winter vegetables, both very good. No serving utensils were offered. I find this really odd for a restaurant that emphasizes sharing. We scraped the food off of the share plates with our forks. Our server returned and we asked her for a wine list. When we had questions about the wine she had to ask the manager to come over, and we were grateful that he did because he was not only helpful, he also cleared our empty dirty plates the server had neglected when she dropped the wine list. He brought our wine out right away and our entree course soon followed. Mushrooms and mashed potatoes. The broccoli rabe we ordered never made it to the table. Our shared entree was the trout. Again, we were offered no serving utensils. Tell me how you would divide up a whole fish with a butter knife. After taking a shot at it, we flagged down our server and got two spoons and a sharp knife. The food was delicious but the trout was really difficult to portion out because the skin was tough (but tasty) and hacking away at it was frustrating. The server came by to ask us how we liked it and we mentioned we would not order the trout again. She came back and said that her manager would like to buy us dessert (very nice) since we were unhappy with the fish. She cleared our plates, and then brushed off the table on to the carpet WITH HER BARE HAND, smearing mashed potato across it. She brought our dessert settings, set them on top of the smear of potato, then realized that was kind of gross, I guess, got a rag, picked up our flatware, wiped the table, and set the flatware back down.   I didn't like my dessert choice (sounded better on the menu than it tasted), but my husband had the chocolate tart and liked it.  The manager stopped over and we mentioned that our server was really very nice but needed some training to have the polish the place seems like it is trying to achieve. I hope they make it because the food is really good and that manager was working his butt off!

UQhZ4rw0-_BfBTot9_MQvw.text: Shared the Octopus and Sea Bass and it was excellent!   Beautiful little bar/restaurant.  Definitely cant wait to go back and try something else.

xmmEHNS87cndfCTqhsQokw.text: Fancy restaurant in Pittsburgh! Good vibes. It's located near Benedum center and Heinz Hall, so it'd be nice to visit before the show. The servers were very nice, and food came out in timely manner. Drinks are on point. Food was good, but was not surprising.

QNAkAAUVEa4S175RfwgB5A.text: Bougie done badly.  (Over-wrought, over-thought, not very good cocktails. Over-priced, too trendy wine list. Did not try the food, unimpressed with the dessert menu.)

EygbhevOlcOEjvgsKoLTTA.text: UPDATE: I attempted to call based on the below suggestion from the restaurant, and I left a message that was never returned.  My husband and I had high expectations for Floor 2, but we were pretty let down. There were definitely things that were fine about the experience, but overall we were left disappointed in our evening.  Two high points of the evening were the cocktails we had at the bar before dinner, as well as our attentive yet not obtrusive waiter. The cocktails were well balanced and inventive, and had excellent presentation. I unfortunately cannot remember the waiter's name, however he was quick to tend to our needs, and was on script for the ambiance of the restaurant.   Unfortunately, most of the food left a lot to be desired. We started with the mussels, which came with grilled bread in a tomato broth. The sauce almost tasted soapy, and 2/3 of the mussel shells were empty. While I understand not all mussel shells always have the meat due to preparation loss, 2/3 is quite extreme. We are usually the people asking for more bread so we can soak up the delicious sauce that comes with the mussels, but we actually didn't even end up finishing the bread because we didn't want to partake in the gross sauce.  I had the sea bass entree, and my husband had the octopus. Both were fine, but fairly uninteresting dishes. The sea bass was just an extremely bland dish.  The ambiance of the restaurant is great, and the view from the second floor is a different one, but I don't think we'll be back.

aixx_lZUSXX4bH-m88BwAw.text: Food was great. Service was spectacular! (Dom, I think?) Try the almond croissant! Will be going back.

9rYjDjBL7HYSLLKTYLkoFA.text: Fl. 2, or Floor 2 at the Fairmont offers an incredibly unique dining experience in the heart of the city. We were traveling in for the EQT 10 Mile Race and stayed at the Fairmont. I travel often for work and have eaten at many of the places in Pittsburgh and this is absolutely one of the, if not the best in town. It's a brand new restaurant offering a fresh design that is unlike anything else in the city. It's modern and refined, while offering a casual feel. The Service: My wife and I were treated to exceptional service for both dinner and Lunch. Special thanks to Gary, Dom, and Rico for the recommendations and full Raw bar experience - outstanding! EVERYONE at the restaurant seems to genuinely take pride in this new concept and went out of their way to make sure we had a great experience. It was enjoyable to see the staff excited for us to try the next course and every detail of each dish/drink was explained to us before trying it. The Drinks: Incredibly unique drink menu with our favorites being Ode to Alexandria and the Smoked Pimientos were drinks unlike anything we've had before. So refreshing and artistic! There is also an entirely local beer selection that highlights the budding Pittsburgh Craft beer scene. Kuddos to the team for designing this with a super-local feel. Most unique drink menu in town and the wine selection is simply fantastic. The Restaurant: Beautifully designed with Copper highlights and an industrial/designer feel that feels very "Pittsburgh" while looking nothing like anything else in Pittsburgh. The Centerpieces of Fl.2 are the 25-person Round bar and a cozy marble fireplace. One of the most beautiful places to enjoy a meal in town. On a side note, my wife and I also thought the music playing during the meal was a nice compliment to the meal. Overall, Fl.2 provides great dining atmosphere, with warm lighting and the feel you're in one of the "hottest spots" in the city! The Food: Wow - unlike anything Ive ever had. Chick Pea Fricassee, the Chicken(best I've ever had) and Pork Belly were among our favorites. The Red Kuri Squash, Pasta, and Desserts were also memorable. Among the most unique aspects of this concept is the Raw bar. There are several species of Oysters, Scallops, and shrimp that were beautifully presented. Apparently the menu will change seasonally and offers such a variety of unique dishes, it would take one 4-5 visits to try everything. Meals are meant to be shared and this is part of the concept. For dinner, we ordered 4-5 different dishes and it provides a great opportunity to try many different items! We will definitely be back and can't thank the staff and servers enough for making it one of the best meals we've ever had! Recommend getting a reservation and get there an hour early to enjoy a drink at the beautiful bar. Check it out...you won't regret it! media-cdn.getbento.com/a...

BsC8VxQ6DAcQhuaIhslJwA.text: Staff was great. Bartender solid. Waiter, Gary, did a great job. She started off with the simple green salad, it was large and fresh but not much else. I had the braised lamb shank, a bit dry, but great portion size. She had the half roasted chicken which was good. In addition, we had the celery root mashed potatoes which were fantastic. Dessert was chocolate torte which did not disappoint. Overall, the ambiance is great, the staff was excellent and the the food was medicare.

yADcM0lggADklAVzk6SCHg.text: This is an amazing spot for breakfast. The servers and in particular the manager/host are fantastic. Kaitlin Bledsoe does an awesome job taking care of customers. The food is very good and fresh and they have some different items on the menu than your traditional breakfast. Top notch customer service from Kaitlin and her team!

d5vS6hcL0vMldaUzDsEuKQ.text: The service and atmosphere were great. Our server was attentive, but the food and beverages were extremely overpriced and frankly unsatisfying. I ordered the sea bass and it was overcooked and burnt on top. My date ordered the rotisserie chicken and it was over seasoned and had more bone than meat. If you are looking for a place to eat with lots of choices this is not the place for you. Also it was restaurant week and we were only given the regular dinner menu. Pretty disappointed in this restaurant, will not be returning.

PQMiBlCG2LEmSo0MTCIuQA.text: It was my first time in this space since it was changed from Habitat. The space looked really nice and the bar looked really cool; I would have insisted on sitting there if I wasnt going for lunch. Our server was nice and helpful. She came to check after each course to make sure all of our needs were met. My friend and I started with the Heirloom Carrots, which were really good paired with the ricotta and greens. I got the grilled romaine, however because of the E. coli scare with romaine, they had a different green and it wasn't as good as it could have been. Something less bitter would have been preferred BUT it's better than getting E. coli so I'm still happy. The horseradish/blue cheese sauce was really good too; the flank steak was cooked well but had a few pieces that were just fat. My friend got the bib salad with salmon and really liked it. We're really excited to go back and overall enjoyed our experience.

nqTGB3wfbPfrgKBCfHX0RA.text: Fl. 2 is second to none in the downtown Pittsburgh brunch market.  It is clean, offers a contemporary ambiance, and most importantly--delicious food at an affordable price.   I had the chicken meatballs and my fiance had the avocado toast.  Both were large portions, delicious, and reasonably priced.    Compared to Or the Whale and Meat and Potatoes, Fl. 2 wins every day of the week (and especially on Saturday and Sunday).

_vw4HVp675Npwu1VYf9oSw.text: Beautiful restaurant. Excellent brunch. Loved the avocado toast and cinnamon roll with duck. Tables are too close to others.... Aisle very crowded near kitchen area. You feel like someone will knock your food off your table. Noisy. But the food is the star.

AhxucPPT1L871IrWoXiHJg.text: We went to their Saturday brunch to celebrate a birthday! The food overall between the 11 of us was sub par and not really worth the money you pay. One of my potatoes was slightly undercooked and the French toast we got was too sweet. One of our forks was dirty too. However the  service and wait staff was wonderful and very kind. He graciously split our check 11 ways and upon request for us a cinnamon roll to substitute a cake for the birthday girl! I probably wouldn't go back as their are better restaurants in the city for brunch. The ambiance was nice though.

JQRpcJXV57b40YVgtMjVog.text: Wasn't that impressed with the food here. The appetizers were good but ordered the steak salad for dinner and it left much to be desired. It was all bitter lettuce with a few pieces of steak. Not the best.

R_ukXomTDdYS41ub_kOMdw.text: Went last night for dinner and was very disappointed.  I ordered the little gem salad and sea bass and my husband ordered the lamb shank and just a house salad and we also ordered the brussels sprouts for our side. The brussels sprouts came out before our salads which were dry and basically lettuce with a small amount of extras on them.  My sea bass was nasty.  It had a cold thick skin that was on top and when I turned the fish over it was brown...  The fish came with some dried up looking mussels and octopus and little square pieces of potato in some watery looking broth.  My husband said his lamb (which was hard to find because it was buried in about two cans of beans ) was not bad but seriously, he will eat anything.  After reading reviews on here looking at what people near us were ordering it seems like you might be better with ordering the french fries.  The drinks were good

Kr3m_rrCLN9gOq5Fc3cn8A.text: Had a very delicious meal there. The waiter just ordered us several dishes off the newly constructed menu. Excellent flavors and presentation. I can truly say these guys care about great food and service. I will Be back

IzMLJfgDLfU1a2yAsn4jAA.text: I came here for a Yelp event. The location is great. It's located downtown In the Fairmont Hotel on the second floor. The decor reflects it's pricing. For Pittsburgh, I would still say it's somewhat pricey. The ingredients are local and so are the recipes. We had a special sample appetizer menu so I can't speak to the quality of the overall menu but what I had was delicious. We had ox tail and pork shoulder.   Again, I didn't order off of the menu but I would recommend giving it a try based on what I sampled.

RJ8bhIIB2idEX1DTBip1OA.text: Gorgeous spot to grab a drink. I love me a specialty cocktail and had a hard time choosing one. My husband got the Kai rise and I went with  Lunch with Joe - just next time i would skip the smoked rosemary (just didn't appreciate that type of scent/taste) and the chickpea fricassee. The chickpeas were rich and creamy and the bread was delicious. The bartender and server were really nice and had great suggestions while we were going over the menu. Can't wait to come back and try other cocktails or maybe brunch.

FkPWb24FJre-SByalQHJmQ.text: I recently stayed at the Fairmont Pittsburgh for 3 nights. One night, my girlfriend and I decided to stop into Fl. 2 to grab a nightcap before heading up to our room. The decor of the bar / restaurant was nice and the drink list was satisfactory, but we had a very unpleasant experience thanks to our bartender. He asked us for our IDs and rudely (and aggressively) questioned my girlfriend about her age and home address (listed on ID). Normally we wouldn't be upset about getting carded, as any upstanding establishment is entitled to do. But the way this man carried on was unacceptable, especially given the circumstances (you're working at the restaurant in an upscale hotel... this isn't some nightclub in Station Square). How can a high-end hotel that caters to travelers from all over the country (and probably the world) be so unaccustomed to seeing an out of state ID (Colorado)? I would avoid Fl. 2's bar unless you'd like to be interrogated...

P51m0_6S3nfNg6PXOELGEQ.text: This is s fun place to grab drinks. The bar is gorgeous and offers some interesting views wherever you sit. We went late at night so I'm not sure if the menu was a late night menu but it didn't seem short on variety. Albeit it did have great selections.

DRXvv7XYJ1E83N2MEMoBBg.text: My waiter has forgotten about me. No refill on my beer. He brought the dessert menu and then deserted me. I had the steak salad. It needed some seasoning. It was pretty bland. I have seen others make similar comments on other items. They'll have to step it up. There are too many good places to eat downtown.

Xaz7GX24yfdwf_WbageUuw.text: Fabulous spot for weekend brunch! The restaurant is gorgeous - flooded with light, modern decor, yet still warm and welcoming. Our server - Don - was excellent: super friendly, offered really helpful recommendations, and was attentive and thoughtful throughout our time there. My husband ordered the Market Breakfast Sandwich - a little smaller in size than we expected, but still delicious. I ordered the French Toast and it was DIVINE! This place will definitely be on our list of Pittsburg favorites - can't wait to return on our next visit to the city!

xaKkOlRwpBB2iuWQwNRhRQ.text: The only reason this gets two stars is because our female bartender was able to save our experience by taking over our service. The bar looks very impressive which is why I was so disappointed with our experience. Our original bartender was by far the most arrogant and egotistical person I have ever had the displeasure of meeting. At no point was he friendly, welcoming or helpful. He walked around thinking he was better than everyone and everything, like a God of a bartender amongst us, which I found funny after trying his poorly made cocktails. If you're staying at the hotel nearby and are ok with spending $16 for a cocktail, take an $8 Uber to another bar near by and purchase an $8 cocktail which I guarantee will be better both in taste and in service.

gJMuArMHLjFUehN6oE8_xQ.text: Fl2, in the lovely Fairmont Hotel was a great choice for Brunch before heading over to the Benedum to see a Sunday matinee of Waitress! Brunch started with a yummy Bloody Mary, followed by a delish version of Avocado Toast. Our server was pretty much perfect! The atmosphere has a great vibe. I would most certainly return as there was much left on the menu to try. Good friends, good food, and maybe you  will be lucky enough to score a seat by the window!

Njcn3k1sIOMQLU0pcJttlA.text: Go! We decided to give this place a shot for a work lunch and were pleasantly surprised.  We were greeted immediately, served quickly, and the food w as delicious.  We also decided to stay for dessert .  I had the Panna Cotta and thought my tastebuds were going to jump out of my mouth... it's that good!  We will be back, with friends!

Xn2eBjEpv4HW-6JBLlt--g.text: We made a reservation for Sunday brunch and when we arrived, we waited nearly 10 minutes to be seated, as the hostess was nowhere to be found. It was not at all crowded and several bartenders stood there and did nothing to acknowledge us or get someone to sat us until we spoke up. When we finally were seated, the table was dirty. We asked the hostess if someone could wipe the table. The hostess got someone, who told us that the table was clean and just stained and then proceeded to demonstrate this by wiping a mark which came clean. When we pointed out that the mess came up, she said it was a stain and walked away. How do you not only refuse to wipe a table, but try to show how it's stained, then upon learning it's not stained, you walk away?! SO RUDE and SO GROSS.   The actual service from our server was really great! He made sure that we had everything we needed and check on us often. He was the best part of our visit, as the food was lackluster and bland.   I don't think we will be back, and I would urge others to not waste their time and money.

dPh9eW5BSMma0fC5ohziBA.text: Very clean and modern decor with a nice view of Pittsburgh.  Excellent wait staff.  I ordered the open chicken sandwich.  It consisted of about 10-12 pieces of cut up chicken in a sauce on top of toasted bread which was overly crunchy, the arugula was so tasty, but I was feeling hungry in just a few short hours from lunchtime. I think they load up the think fries to compensate for the smaller portions.  So for that I was not happy.  I don't think i will return for food but perhaps a cocktail.

ZwgZZijFvuuIdXtXXqsmhw.text: I had the braised lamb. It was outstanding. We also had sides of brussel sprouts and roasted cauliflower. Both sides were good. I preferred the brussel sprouts.   Would recommend this site and definitely get the lamb!

KNA5o5h3mSbPVFKqqXUTPQ.text: Stopped here for breakfast. The bar was wide open.  Service was great. Prices were reasonable. Got the french omelette and a side of seaside tomatoes. Esposito got the breakfast sandwich and the stuffed french toast. We enjoyed this.

QdgIGS0otX48BfiVHaYfVQ.text: Disappointing and expensive.  We were a party of three discussing what type of red wine we wanted to order.  Our waiter, overhearing the conversation, recommended a bottle of wine.  We took the recommendation and it was the opposite of what we were looking for -- and it cost $100!  Food was fine, not exceptional.  Several dishes were a miss--octopus was not fresh, and steak was not cooked to order.  With so many fine restaurants to choose from, this is a miss if visiting Pittsburgh for a few days.

YLFqgjIuPkCi-yjbNT67Wg.text: First time hotel guest at the Fairmont and since it was kind of late on a Monday I thought I'd give this highly rated place a try....  Unfortunately should have taken a walk.   Beautiful space- food was very good - pretty good size crowd. All off to a good start.   Now the not so good. Looks like there is one run ragged woman behind the bar serving the whole place. Everyone I talk to at the bar is asking what department I work for at PNC bank and isn't it great that we get 1/2 price drinks and free apps   Bottom Line- whoever is running this place might want to consider staffing properly for the headcount not the revenue because you're going to end up with a  bunch of guests at the finest hotel in Pittsburgh wondering how they ended up in a college bar inside. I'll wait half an hour to order wings and a draft colors light but wouldn't expect it at a place of this caliber.   BTW- the food was very good and the woman behind the bar did a fabulous job of making the most of a bad situation.

y47bCWzL8GqXvh97eQr57Q.text: Went to Fl.2 for lunch and shared a bunch of apps, entrees, and desserts, and so was able to get a good sense of the lunch menu/food.   Overall, a much better menu than habitat and better makeover to the restaurant, including the new bar, which is pretty Grand.  Here are the dishes I tried and the grades.  1. heirloom carrots. B+. Very solid appetizer. The sweet ricotta on the bottom made the dish. Wished the carrots were cooked more, as the server said they would be blistered (but they weren't). I would order it again.  2. Chickpea fricassee. B. My table mates liked this a lot more than me. I thought it was average. The tomato base kind of obscured garlic aioli.   3. Chicken and Brie tartine. B+. This was a fresh open faced sandwich, with argula and roasted chicken. Very large portion. My only complaint was I didn't get any real Brie taste in it-- would up the brie (and aioli) and decrease the amount of chicken. But overall, very solid.  4. Hamburger. A. Burger was great. Liked how it was on a sesame seed bun. I'm not sure, but I felt like they may have sous vide it, as it was really moist. The shoe string fries were terrific!   5. Steak frites. B. Good flavor to the steak, but was disappointed that there was no chimichurri sauce, as advertised. I guess they cook the steak in the sauce, but didn't really get that flavor from the dish. But an overall good steak, cooked properly. Same great fries.  6. Beignets. B. Just okay. I thought they didn't need the chocolate sauce in them, as there already was a honey sauce on the plate.   7. Babka. B-. Too dense for my taste. I'm not sure if a babka is supposed to be like that. But good  flavor.  8. Fruit tart. A+. I may be a sucker for a good tart, but it was terrific. Creamy lemony base, fresh raspberries, and perfect crust. Really nice dessert.  9. Coffee. A+. Not sure where they get their coffee, but it's first rate.   Service was a tad slow, but otherwise fine. Overall, a huge improvement over habitat and I would recommend giving it a shot. Will have to try it for dinner.

vdukW83TxJWQ_o1wA2PYjA.text: Had a perfect birthday dinner at fl 2. We opted for 4 surprise courses, selected by our waiter (Jared) with custom wine pairings. We had dishes that we would have never ordered ourselves, they were excellent.

Gnb1KdfMBFICDMdgLN1wUQ.text: The service is good. The atmosphere is to die for and the decor is stunning. The food was very good as well. Personally, I can't wait to go back and I would definitely recommend it. My only complaint would be the menu- it's different- so for some people it may feel very limited. Also- the portion sizes weren't huge so don't go on a completely empty stomach!

XGBYsnivvnXZV1m7RU0noQ.text: Had dinner here last night. First was a bit disappointed with the atmosphere. For a hip downtown location very much felt like a hotel bar/restaurant. Food was quite mediocre. Ordered the empanadas (no flavor in the breading or meat); sea bass (fish and its broth were not seasoned well) and the ratatouille (actually good). Server was nice though!

GTEI-UxuYZSQ2kY9rUShKA.text: Excellent brunch service on a rainy Sunday afternoon. The juices we ordered from the "zero-proof" section of the drink list were super fresh and tasted great. Celery, cucumber, ginger, and something else I can't recall. It was seriously so good though. I ordered the farm egg omelette and can comfortably say it's one of the top 5 omelettes I've had in my entire life. I think omelettes are one of the most perfect food combinations ever contrived, so I've had a ton of omelette in my day, but this one really stood out. To round out the plate, it came with equally good, if not better, tasting fried potatoes that almost stole the show. My girlfriend got the avocado toast, and there must be a wizard chained to the wall in the back, because that avocado was PERFECTLY ripe, which never happens. It came with tomatoes, and a cream topping that made me jealous I got an omelette (until I started to eat my omelette and was then immediately placated) Anyway, can't wait to get back here!

nxAU_KFkznMExwMdvpm8Bw.text: Ugh!  The service was great, from the hostess to the attentive waiter.  Lunch with Joe cocktail was fun and unique - smoked rosemary.  However, the reason I come to a restaurant is for the food and unfortunately, it was a huge disappointment.  Don't waste your time or money.  We had the ribeye and it was supposed to be family style.  I don't know how you can mess a steak up that bad...but Floor 2 did.  Poor quality steak and the preparation was horrible.  Served with potatoes (hardly any) and broccolini (one that was in pieces).  Asked for more broccolini  and was additionally charged.  Felt too bad to say anything to our fabulous waiter.  Will not be returning.

4DiFa6Hn5QeRNQ65HO0AsA.text: My wife and I came here to celebrate her PhD. We left celebrating the creamed corn. The cream corn is legitimately the best thing I have ever eaten in my life! I am stunned right now that a dish so simple could be so delicious.

2eWFvSrFSO-8ltvBoFLLwQ.text: This place it top notch and a great place to have coffee and dessert. Greg our waiter was amazing and so personable. The atmosphere is awesome with the open kitchen view. Highly suggest just to stop and get cocktails and a light dinner. Not very busy because people don't know it exists yet.

5Ntq6Fzr-9mD6ynSNAYmZg.text: Came here for happy hour and found out that they have great appetizers. I've heard good thing about the brunch menu. After trying out the appetizer, I think I will comeback for brunch or dinner. The atmosphere and music are great as well.

c8cST4QS2d84xLlu89Jrdg.text: Lovely! I stopped in on a chilly morning a few days before Christmas and had a simply delightful breakfast experience.   The space is bright and airy with big windows that look out toward Market Square and downtown (especially cool with all of the holiday lights that are up right now).  The staff -- from the hostess, to the lady who walked me to my table, to the waitress -- were gregarious and full of smiles (always a good thing when you're not quite ready to "morning"). The coffee was strong and piping hot and my breakfast -- avocado toast with poached eggs and cherry tomatoes -- was just wonderful. The bread that all this was served on was dense and flavorful (not sure its origin, but really good and hearty) and the eggs were *perfectly* poached.   In all, a terrific breakfast experience and I'll be back soon to check out the dinner offerings!

photos.caption: Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YphkU8cdVAR_JzGKrRBcYw.text: Food was pretty good.. Great location.. Great view...  Lots of potential for it to be an IT spot.. And service was friendly too.  BUT  Maybe it was just a...  One off...   However....  For us...  It...  Was.....  So.....  Gosh....  Darn...  S  L  O  W . . .

KOtmtLUBxbkQ8tFh4muU6Q.text: Hands down, one of the best meals I've had in my life! I had a few friends come in from Las Vegas who work in the food industry there and they were really excited to see what Pittsburgh had to offer. The idea to go to dinner was pretty last minute so a lot of well known places were booked up. Luckily, on Open Table I saw a reservation for Floor 2 open that night.   The first thing you'll notice is that the place is beautiful. You feel like you are in a Mad Men episode and nothing you are wearing is cool enough. Everything is shareable which is the way everything in life should be. We ordered so many good things. Some of my favorites would be the chickpea fricassee and the agnolotti. The pasta was perfectly cooked  and delicate. Plus, anything with brown butter is beautiful. The food was impeccable, the vibe was amazing and the service was fantastic.. Out of close to 10 dishes, there wasn't a single miss. I can't wait to keep going back to this place and eating everything possible!

fWE41no-DR-eQaqyHSwYgg.text: Bar and restaurant really redesigned to take advantage of the 2nd floor location with plenty of windows surrounding it. Had appetizers and drinks at the bar. Flatbread with carmelized onions was delicious. Great creative menu with lots of locally-sourced ingredients.

zK0OdXASd6aEng1pl2i6XA.text: Enjoyed our dinner after going to the theater. Attentive service. Waiter did a nice job explaining the specials and the ingredients. You're gonna spend a few $$ but the food is worth it.

ffK37vtdAlbLZg2abkGBHQ.text: A gorgeous space with a very courteous staff! While the service was wonderful, the food was a bit lacking. Among our five, we ordered the Pupusa (2 thumbs up), the Breakfast Sandwich (great), an American Breakfast (standard) and two would-be grilled romaine steak salads. Given the recent romaine issues, the chef substituted what we were told would be a mix of spring mix and iceberg, but was more akin to bok choy or something similar. Unfortunately, the bitterness of the lettuce far outweighed any semblance of steak taste, though I'm not sure it was that much to speak of, unfortunately. This doesn't mean I won't try Floor 2 again - the space alone is worth the trip! But tread carefully on this particular "Floor."

abhiKnnZo7J9J0_mYp_47g.text: Four of us went here after a late night show at the Benedum. I'll be honest. When we walked in I loved the bar but was not real impressed with the decor of the restaurant. But, my opinion changed real quick!!! Our waiter Zack was absolutely amazing!! He made the dining experience a pure pleasure. His appetizer and main course selection were spot on! We all enjoyed the food tremendously but because of Zacks hospitality and great conversation, he made the entire experience enjoyable! Would definitely go back here and request Zack as our waiter.

jCJXSlZnn_168gTnCYiEZw.text: What an amazing interior!  I love the design, materials, mirrors, and general feel of the place.  Another plus (in my book) is the nice silverware and plates.  I feel some places have amazing food and the place settings can hurt the overall experience.  Right off the bat this place has a lot going for it.  Then, add an amazingly friendly hostess, and waitress and things are even better!   But I feel like that's where the experience stopped.  Our Saturday brunch started with luke warm coffee.  The waitress quickly replaced it with a fresh piping hot carafe!   The cinnamon roll was HUGE!!  It arrived in a cast iron pan that gave it a look of straight out of the oven.  Imagine the sadness we had when it was only barely warm.   And finally, the main dishes with omelettes and potatoes arrived.  The potatoes were basically large fried versions of something you might find at an amusement park or a fast food place late at night. The omelettes were passable but overall another miss as well and very rich.   It's very sad for me to write a negative review but the food part of the experience just wasn't good.  If you have loads of money I'd say give it a try - maybe it'll be better for you and you can at least enjoy the ambiance and the very nice coffee cups  But at the prices being charged (which isn't too much different than other similar places downtown) I'd say look at recent reviews for this place and maybe something has changed.  If not, maybe venture somewhere else.

Wc-25FIYM15HxUw0avvIBg.text: I had dinner at Floor 2 last week for my birthday and it was such a treat! We had reservations for 7:30pm and were seated right away. There were a few occupied tables in the bar area and people scattered around the bar, but the dining room was mostly empty.  It is, as other reviewers mentioned, an absolutely gorgeous space. The high ceilings and warm lighting give Fl2 a very upscale feel.  I adored the details such as the open kitchen with the hanging copper cookware and being able to see the chefs at work, and the fact that our table was set with mismatched place settings that somehow seemed to work perfectly together.  We ordered the tartare and a bottle of cab to start. The app came out fresh with thin, but crisp crackers and a whipped spread.  While I'm not typically a fan of tartare, this was good and was light enough to not fill us up, but curb our hunger and make us excited for dinner.  I decided on the sea bass entree which came over a type of stew - mussels, calamari and potatoes in a red base.  It was so flavorful and cooked to perfection.  My date ordered the lamb and totally loved it.  I tried a bite and it was smokey, tender and a little spicy.  Great flavors and an even better presentation.  As the evening went on, more tables were occupied and we got to see some other dishes come from the kitchen. I think if I came back, I'd try one of their salads because they looked so good!  We finished with the apple sherbet dessert and while I wasn't keen on dessert at first, it was incredible.  Definitely something to try if you get the chance to come here!  Our service was great and our waitress was very engaging.  She offered excellent recommendations and was extremely accommodating (asking if we were on a time constraint or had the evening to enjoy the food and atmosphere, etc).  Overall it was a flawless visit and I wouldn't change a single thing.  Absolutely recommend if you're looking for a nice experience in a beautiful setting with great food!

AxRC9i-G3EGCwOnqXbbTpA.text: Lamb shank was great. Pretty slow service. Took over an hour to get our food. My husband got the sea bass and was underwhelmed. Next time will order the lamb to go!!!

sZwMXwqG6TLGAmTOB_F--A.text: Great place for dessert and cocktails! The place was bustling and had a good vibe, the staff was friendly and prompt with the order. A great place for a romantic night out or with friends, we had one date night and one dinner with friends here and had a great time.

DMFhdkwYwPut7Y_ygsItHA.text: We really enjoyed our evening here-from our server Jared to the awesome ribeye and lamb shank. The vibes are great as well! Loved the atmosphere.   We will definitely be back and recommend that you stop by when downtown for dinner and drinks.

PndOKfr12taTLuS1sSYmJA.text: After a long day of work, on a Saturday no less, one often seeks to dine out at a fabulous place. If this is you, don't go to Fl. 2. The food is mediocre, unimaginative, and dull. The atmosphere are loud. But hey--the service was great. There are better choices within a stone's throw--try them first.

OWWzBFwS-OR06Kmt2FWWvA.text: First time having breakfast here and the best softest moist omelet I have ever had and I love omelets.  The fluffiness of the omelet was amazing. Spinach and ham dices were tucked in the middle. The bacon was thick large and chewy. Very large diced Potatoes will come along with it.  I was stuffed and I eat a lot for breakfast.  Definitely two thumbs up for this breakfast item.  Jesse was excellent in his service. Will have breakfast again here on my next stay.

RILOh0o_iUdMoc1I06iwNA.text: They apparently don't need our business  We used to dine regularly at Floor 2. Lately I've called twice to ask if they can honor a dietary restriction I have. No one returned my calls. It seems that as a hotel restaurant, they don't care if locals dine with them. We won't bother going there again.

ZbfuCjCqgJI3zP_saSxkOA.text: Located inside the Fairmont Hotel downtown this place has a nice atmosphere for a special night out.  We went for Sunday brunch and it was very busy.  The menu has a lot of options and I went with my traditional eggs, toast, potatoes and sausage.  They would not let me substitute bacon for the sausage-chef does not allow substitutions which is annoying. The forgot my toast and I had to wait a while to get jam, ketchup and salt and pepper.  Others in my party got the romaine steak salad and were very disappointed although the presentation was spot on.  The breakfast sandwich served with a side of potatoes got rave reviews.  The brunch entrees are pricy are just ok for what you are paying for.

bonXpaj2vaCEHCw5ZmJN2g.text: Came here for brunch on Saturday. When you walk in, the grand bar is the first thing you see. The dining room has an open kitchen and a wall with the Pittsburgh skyline. We both started off with the zero proof cocktails. I had the berry smash, which was raspberry, blueberry, mint, lemon, and soda. The drink was beautiful and delicious. It was sweet but refreshing as well. My friend had the clean and green, which was very light and cleansing.   For brunch, I had the poached eggs, which was oxtail jam, spinach, gougere, and hollandaise. Wow, this was definitely one of my favorite versions of eggs benedict in the city. The hollandaise was heavenly and the gougere was a nice change from a traditional english muffin. My friend had the avocado toast and enjoyed her meal. She had just wished hers maybe came with a side. Overall, an excellent place to grab brunch. The only reason I do not give 5 stars is that our server forgot about us. Once we got our food, he never came to check on us, refill our water, or even give our check. I had to ask another waiter to get him to get our check.

vwJcx6kSqXKKSd_IV8b3nA.text: We came here for brunch and after a miscommunication in timing of brunch, we ended up with breakfast only. While the website does say the hours for breakfast and brunch, it's a little weird to start brunch on the weekends at 11 and I feel they need to have that more displayed on the website in terms of put it on the menu. Specifically when you pull up the menus from open table or yelp, there is no way to see that brunch doesn't start till 11 unless you go to a specific sub link on the website. That needs to be prominently viewed, especially when most places start brunch earlier.   While we were fine with this miscommunication because partly our fault, the host staff was a little rude to us and balked at our "stupidity" that we didn't know brunch was at 11 and was not any way accommodating to us asking further questions on the matter. It was a misunderstanding on our part but they were out of line and simply rude towards us.   Next we felt like our waitress was pushing us out the door from the moment we sat down. She rushed us to choose our meal and brought us our food quickly. And when we initially asked about mimosas to the waitstaff and hostess, they said not until brunch at 11. Well we saw other tables had mimosas and bloody Mary's, so obviously they either don't know their own restaurant or they lied to us, neither bodes well. When we did ask for mimosas towards the end after seeing other tables, our waitress brought us the mimosas and then promptly the Check thereafter before we even had a sip or two. Definitely felt like she wanted us gone ASAP   The one redeeming quality was the food  and the mimosa (when we finally got one) were good (not worth the price or poor waitstaff). But even then you didn't get a lot of food for your money. However nothing can make up for how poorly we felt we were treated by the waitstaff.  Honestly if you're looking for a good brunch experience, I don't advise coming here as we experienced much better places on our visit.

RjteHbDwnkWwnQfsNhEScA.text: Floor 2 is beautiful! The interior itself is worth coming to see. I had brunch here recently with friends. Was surprised to see how empty they were during Sunday brunch hours. A few of my friends got a juice off their great juice menu. I got the "Lunch with Joe": prosecco, lemon juice, elderflower, smoked rosemary. I don't think I'd ever had a drink like that before. It was definitely very, very smokey, and overall pretty good.   For my entree, I had the lamb gyro, which I thought was disappointing. The lamb tasted really bland to me and I only ate about half of it. The portion size was large though! The gyro came with a generous serving of fries, which made me happy. They were very simple and good.   Our server was very friendly and conversational.   Taste | 3.5-4 Atmosphere | 5 Presentation | 3.5 Service | 4 OVERALL | 3.5-4

2MBxovcrCW9LGGmGpEY2-g.text: I stopped by here this past Wednesday with my wife for dinner.  Ever since I had been to a Yelp party here, I had wanted to bring my wife and Pittsburgh Restaurant week gave me the perfect chance.  The inside of Floor 2 is what I would consider classy.  It is L shaped with the front part being a giant square shaped bar and then the back part is the dining area.  Whenever I first walked in on this evening I thought that it was pretty empty only to turn the corner and find it reasonably full.  In any case, they have an array of interesting lighting here and then a bunch of tables and a central area which has half chair/half booth seating.  Last but certainly not least, Floor 2 has an open kitchen along with a chef's bar looking into it where you can also sit.  Since it was Pittsburgh restaurant week, both my wife and I opted to go off of their 3 course pre-fixe menu.  I ended up going with the poblano soup for my starter, lamb neck bolognese for my entree and then the only dessert option was the Japanese Cheesecake.  The menu didn't say too much about each but that the poblano soup came with guajillo oil, the lamb neck bolognese was with pappardelle, mushrooms and Parmesan while the Japanese cheesecake came with matcha and preserved cherries.  Our soups came out first and looked Christmasy with the green base and red colored oil.  The base was blended nicely and really tasted of poblanos while the oil added some much appreciated heat to the dish. While I enjoyed the dish, I don't know that it is something I would have ordered from the menu.  Next up was the lamb neck bolognese.  With the way the pasta was twirled on the plate, it didn't look like much.  Thankfully that was deceiving and there was a lot more there than I expected.  The noodles were a bit more al dente than I liked but the sauce and other ingredients were great.  My lamb was tender and the sauce had a surprising heat to it which crept up on me.  For dessert the Japanese cheesecake was plated beautifully with the green matcha sifted onto a black plate with the cheesecake in the middle and the front covered with cherries.  The cheesecake here was surprisingly light and also tasty.  I enjoyed it with both the preserved cherries and the matcha powder.  However, I wasn't a big fan of all three together and so I took care to eat pieces with only one of the toppings and thoroughly enjoyed it.  The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  I definitely ordered some things from the restaurant week menu that I otherwise wouldn't have and would be interested to try more.

xtWmSoOE6Hhz-pHd5qRo3Q.text: I am pleasantly surprised how great my lunch was here! Not because I was judging them based on the former restaurant here, Habitat (okay, maybe a little), but because I came for lunch. I am never very excited about lunch. I love breakfast and dinner. Lunch is usually boring!  It was not boring here, I'm happy to report! I had a delicious rotisserie chicken salad. It was on a bed of bitter greens, but the honey dijon dressing really balanced everything out. It was also complemented by a generous sprinkling of pomegranate and apple slices.   Service was friendly and the ambiance is modern, yet warm. I like the updates they made because it seems sleeker and fits in well with the hotel. I'm excited to try dinner there now!  Celiac/Gluten Free review: They were super accommodating when I told them I had celiac disease. They don't have a GF menu, but they can accommodate dietary requests, which is nice (they said they don't even have peanuts in the kitchen because of allergies). I'm happy to report I did not get sick, so no cross contamination concerns and I'd feel comfortable coming back!

7SsbxUY-SNH-BqLJB-H2fg.text: I took my friend to Floor 2 for a celebratory birthday lunch on a Wednesday afternoon. We decided having 1 cocktail with lunch was an acceptable indulgence, and we both went with "spring in the 'burgh". It was SO good! Made with elderflower tonic water and Parking Chair vodka (made locally in lawrenceville), this drink was perfection! Complete with edible flowers in the ice cubes  My friend had the Tagliatelle - delicious, so much lump crab - and I went with the Local Trout. My fish was cooked perfectly and the accompanying spicy pomodoro was super tasty. They even brought out a complimentary birthday treat! Generally speaking, I was pleasantly surprised from start to finish. Make a reservation now - your tastebuds will thank you!

q-OquHgSEC3PuMEMZNeOMw.text: Went for a pre-show dinner, so did not have our usual lingering time over dinner and so just stuck to a drink, a main and a desert. The place is just outstanding in terms of decor. There are three different seating areas and a bar area. Each it's own outstanding decorating achievement. Must see to appreciate. I think the ambiance is in perfect keeping with the restaurants 'modern American' theme. Plus they have an open Kitchen concept in the farthest back dining area.  Of course we were there for dinner but they have a Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Brunch and Bar menu.  The have a Raw bar with items such a oysters and scallop crudo. They keep things tight so the menu is not over large and everything is prepared to your order.  Some of the mains are:  agnolotti (a refined version of ravioli); octopus with lentils (did not have it, but it looked great at the next table); roasted chicken; lamb shank; and the sea bass which we had and enjoyed immensely.  The Sea Bass comes with, and in, and on, saffron potatoes, with fennel in a rich outstanding bouillabaisse broth. In the broth also several mussels, and very tender squid (calamari).  It's really hard to overstate how delicious this meal was. You will want a spoon and some toasted bread for dipping to enjoy the broth to it's fullest.  Service was outstanding with a highly knowledgeable and sharp staff.  Our server could recite every minute detail of every dish and was prompt and courteous and very helpful.   For a desert we split a chocolate torte, which is sort of an understated name for a silky delicious concoction of milk chocolate ganache, dark chocolate mousse with luxardo cheeries (could have eaten a bowl more of these) and some fresh whipped topping. Oh my goodness. This was just outstanding and went very well with a beautifully made espresso.   This was our first time at the 'new' themed and chefed restaurant in the Fairmont hotel, and what a delicious discovery it was.

czs9VzxXKHfYh8s0jGxoKw.text: Exceptional.  I went as a group to fl 2, and I just had a great time all the way through. The restaurant is located on the second floor (yeah you guessed it) of a hotel, and the hotel+restaurant aesthetic is just amazing. Fl 2 is super modern, clean, and so open. The bar has one of the most beautiful displays I've ever seen, and overall, the space is just overwhelming in polish.  My waiter was super cool, and was very attentive with our table. As for the food, wow for the selection. They have all the favorites, from salad to steak, and even vegetarian favorites (ratatouille!) and fun seafood options like mussel. If you come with a group, you'll definitely be able to experience the amazing array of food options.  I had a table full of food, but some highlights were the chickpeas, which if you like a tangy, sour feel, is very fun. The ratatouille was amazing, which coming from a meat lover, means a lot. The veggies weren't sliced thin like they do in the movie, but they were baked well and the sauce was just so wholesome and comforting to eat. As for the other entrees I chose, I wasn't too impressed by them. The 28 oz ribeye had high expectations, and I thought that the meat just wasn't seasoned fully and seared well enough. The meat quality was good, but the texture was a bit tight and it wasn't too savory chewing through the meat. The sea bass was alright, but the jumbalaya choice for the soup was a mistake in my opinion. Mixing in calamari, mussles, and even potatos (???) into a tomato soup was quite a weird combination with the bass, and I wasn't too happy with that.  Overall, the presentation and atmosphere really makes this place a must if you happen to be downtown in Pittsburgh.

43Mt_Tlh14DrcXi8XLcOyQ.text: Celebrated a big birthday here with my mother. It was excellent from start to finish. She shocked my by allowing the server to choose a special tasting menu for the occasion (she's a pretty picky eater). Jarod, our server, was outstanding!   Here's how it went:  - Cold lobster salad with fennel. Perfectly seasoned and delicious.  - Chick peas in tomato sauce. What a surprise for the taste buds! Middle Eastern flavors and to die for  - Roasted cauliflower was an explosion of flavor. And I don't even like cauliflower!  - Full trout was tender and mild. We had them remove the head   My mother, who doesn't drink, was going to order her normal iced tea and joked about how she would have ordered a marshmallow martini if they had one (like Applebee's! ). Well, Jerod made it happen and it was the hit of the entire meal!!!   Just when we thought it was over, they brought a gorgeous blueberry meringue dessert. Heavenly.   We also had breakfast the next day and it was delish! Highly recommend the avocado toast   Thank you FL2 for an awesome experience!

F8LWvkli7BGfi2k0VXvbVw.text: We came here when visiting Pittsburgh because it came with a nice view. I'll be honest and say that the view is eh (just the streets of downtown Pittsburgh). But everything else was a treat. It had a classy, vibrant, yet modern feel with fantastic service and a lively ambiance. They say tapas style but I'd say the portions are pretty big compared to what I'm used to in DC.   My favorite dish of the night was surprisingly the chickpeas! They were perfectly cooked in a impressive savory tomato-balsamic herby sauce. The sauce had depth and kept us coming back for more.   The other dishes we got were mouth-watering also, from the ratatouille to the sea bass with a nice crispy skin to the pork belly.

ZM93e0nakKT7prVxb7hUnw.text: While the bar and restaurant were truly a beautiful space the service really turned me off to this place.  Came for a private event which seemed unorganized and fl2 completely unprepared.  The bartenders were totally unwelcoming to our group.  The male bartender completely ignored us if we had a free drink ticket and even though it took 3 separate tries and a total of about 40 min I was able to finally get a drink from the female bartender- which if I'm being honest- was not worth the wait but it might've been the sour attitude that made it not so tasty.  It's not like I wouldn't have tipped but it was a real struggle and it seemed like they were actively trying to be rude by avoiding us so I didn't tip but I would've!  It was not a good look for them and made me not want to return.    While I appreciate the opportunity to check out a new place with the private event (co-hosted by floor 2) I really felt unwelcomed and more like we were a bother - I really don't know why they hosted if they didn't want us there.  Out of the 5 things we sampled I enjoyed the chick pea bite as well as the pork belly bite - although I don't think they're on the menu anyway but they should be because they were good.    I wish it was a better experience because I would love to support Floor 2

iunKyR-w3UMhloHQfh2G9g.text: Delicious food and revamped concept here! I had the striploin steak, which was prepared exactly to temperature. However, it was a little more broiled than grilled and I would've preferred more of a grilled taste. I also had the rice pudding dessert, which was great. It had a granola and bruleed citrus topping that really enhanced the taste and flavor. They were also running a $5 wine special and the wines were delicious!  We did have an issue with our service. We had a 6pm reservation in advance of a 7:30 show, which we communicated at the beginning. We were one of only a couple tables in the restaurant so it shouldn't have been an issue. There was some glitch with our dessert order and it came our very late so we ended up being late for our show.

kCTTgMotKJCUmiq2TGLqXA.text: Had a client in town, and this was a convenient location. The menu seems to offer a little of everything. The oysters tasted fresh, and were a great way to start. We had the sea bass and the lamb, and both were delicious. We both had the Japanese Cheesecake to end the night. Neither of us were fans of this desert, but I'm not sure that's the restaurant's fault as much as me not liking this style of cheesecake. Looking forward to stopping in again!

1fkmRNqzFaMZSsZaaCiRHw.text: I went here for a private event, but also ordered from the bar and off of them menu during the event. When I first got there, I went to the bar to get a drink. It took 18 minutes for anyone to come over to me, no one gave me a menu or water. I actually had to borrow a menu from someone next to me at the bar, which is no big deal, but it seemed like the bartender was purposely ignoring anyone from the private event.   When the manager finally came over to take my order, someone I knew had shown up. Even though we told her we would be on separate checks, she put both drinks on my check anyways (more on this later).   We were seated for the private event, and I asked for a waiter so we could order off of the menu. Our waiter Don was amazing! This was the only good thing about Floor 2, in my opinion. He was helpful, friendly, and nice to us.   We ordered a simple green salad, that is supposed to include apple, arugula, and parmesan. What came was a plate of arugula, with little to no dressing or anything else. It tasted like arugula with water on it. We also ordered a cheese plate, this was good, no complaints there. Finally we got fries. They were cold, and there was nothing special about them anyway.  So, I go to close out with the waiter and he tells me that the bar will not let him transfer the tab and I have to go pay there, which is fine. I go to the bar, where I can hear the bartender now complaining about the people from the private event. He walks around me, not making eye contact and then finally says I will get to you in a minute. When he finally comes over I ask to close my tab and he tells me that both drinks are still on it, I tell him again that I only had one drink, and he gets the manager. They cancel out the ticket completely (from what I can tell), and then recharge me for my drink, which would be fine, but it is no longer happy hour, so my $5 beer rings up at $9, but at this point I am sick of the guys attitude, so I just pay and leave.   Really, this was a bad experience. I left having overpaid and went to get dinner somewhere else.

0yNh9L7mVLJXSWImJJ5gzw.text: The food was overall good but expensive.  The mussels were delicious.  The cinnamon bun was huge and tasty.  However, it was also room temperature for some reason despite arriving in a cast iron pan that implied it would be warm (and It would have been much better if it had been warm too).

Ap7AngPMEz2T7nVLgBwOwQ.text: Post 10-mile race, we tried Fl.2 for brunch this past weekend.    Hot chocolate "As big as my head" raved girlfriend.  (with kahlua, and whipped cream on top to boot).    It's a nice, clean space with a surprising view given that it commands only a second floor spot.  It feels open and modern.    The food was...a lot.  And really good.  I made the mistake of ordering a cinnamon roll (it came in a 10" cast iron skillet, covered in sour cream frosting) AND poached egg (lobster/cheese/biscuit/dippy egg...*mouth waters*), which was decadent and filling and...if we're honest, sat like a delicious lead weight in my stomach for hours afterward.    My girlfriend rolled me to my car and I bemoaned my gluttony until supper that night when I was finally able to contemplate eating something else.    Wait staff was friendly and helpful.

ObClTJb49crAZvy9hC0tPw.text: We decided to try Floor 2 for my birthday celebration. The place looks so cool and modern.  The service was outstanding.  As far as the food, wow! We shared the fried oysters and I ordered the braised lamb shank and my husband had Striploin for the entree. We ordered wild mushrooms as an additional side and substituted my meal's side with mashed potatoes. The meals already come with some sides but it's nice to have extra.  The only thing we didn't love that with the exemption of the mushrooms everything was just lukewarm. This was mostly my husband's complain. Besides that, I thought this was the best food I had for a long time!! The presentation was beautiful and so delicious. The final verdict was that he doesn't want to return because of the food not being hot but I do. Actually, I can't wait to go back again and will recommend this place to my friends.  The only thing I wish I knew was checking our valet parking ticket.  I think you can ask the hostess or waitress to call in for the car.  After we paid $24 for parking the front desk staff wasn't helpful. He didn't call to valet, just handed the ticket back. We had to wait outside in the freezing cold because there was a bit of a traffic jam in front of the hotel and nobody was moving.

photos.caption: Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried oyster tartine
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised Lamb shank with mashed potatoes
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Enz7e5pMRLKeFioU0nrG-Q.text: Came here for a post graduation brunch. Not at all bad. The highlight was actually the cocktail. The bartender knew her ish! She made me a perfect caipirinha with the right amount of sweetness and like. Perfect for that humid brunch time!  The graduate had a Smokey floral cocktail which was absolutely mind blowing, forgot the name. Having said that I Doubt you'll go wrong with the cocktails   For the food, nothing outside the ordinary for a brunch menu. I had the quiche in which the eggy custard was well seasoned. The crust was a little too overdone but not bad all in all! My buddy had the chicken crepes and I wish I had gotten those Bc the shredded chicken and aioli they served the flakey pockets in was just delightful.   Overall the winners in my opinion are the ambience (beautifully decorated and swanky) and the cocktails. The bar is pristine and the bartender was fantastic !  The food is good and won't be steered wrong but again nothing that crosses Barriers. If I was a hotel guest I would be more than thrilled to have this at my doorstep !

ll3hgkk9Qm2z0vfLUqdqag.text: This restaurant is so wonderfully decorated. It so clean and fresh looking, very inviting. The bar area is also beautiful with comfortable seating around the bar. I love all the windows and the ability to be able to look out over town while sitting at the tables. I shared only a few items off their menu. The simple green salad was very good, perfect amount of dressing. Their shoestring fries had a good taste to them. I actually put them in my salad and that was delicious, not really the restaurants ' style though haha. They are fancy in their presentation and price. I also had some of the fromage and charcuterie and the cheese was really good along with the mustard and honey comb.

photos.caption: Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

z7RpN4s0rM5yhIFw9JL2fw.text: Greta venue, but terrible service. I have been to floor 2 on several occasions and every time the service is terrible. I understand the prices but it is way overpriced to the point I most likely won't be back. A group of us walked in and the hostess never offered to place our coats in cost room which was in use. The manager then moved out seats that the hostess set up. It is a nice place to hang and relax but the service is trash.

DiWzBbzG5k7siOMyCTzlPA.text: I was finally able to stop in here recently for lunch after having heard some great things.  From the moment you walk in the place has a really cool feel to it.  The bar area is very modern and different looking.  It would be a great spot for a happy hour.  For my meal I went went with the French dip.  This was one of the best French dips I have ever had.  The meat was tender,l and the horseradish sauce complimented it perfectly.  The bun was also one of the best parts of the sandwich.  Sometimes places will use cheap bread with a French dip which can cause the sandwich to become soggy or fall apart.  The bread here however was fresh, crisp, and stayed together when dipped in the au jus.  On the side they give you a mound of fries that no one person could finish.  They were also delicious.  I will definitely stop back to try some of the other menu options.

photos.caption: Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bar area
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French dip

vClnhQ3DBHbfDTb-AUZORg.text: I was in Pittsburgh earlier this month on a visit. Before coming, I did some research regarding the best places to eat and Floor 2 kept coming up. Given my limited time, I initially thought I wouldn't get a chance to try it; however, when I realized it opens at 6:30am, I knew I had to come in for breakfast before heading to the airport. I'm glad I did because it was one of the best breakfast I've had.  To start Floor 2 is located inside the Fairmont hotel. The place is large, elegant, and modern. Beautiful place.   Since I got there around 6:45am, the breakfast menu was available. I started with some coffee, as well as some scrambled eggs with cheese and bacon, which felt high quality and delicious. Then, I ordered the French toast, which was the star of the show. The slices were huge, the cream and fruit were fresh, and the syrup delicious. Incan honestly say that it's the best I've had.  It is worth mentioning that this place is not cheap. I spent way over my usual budget for breakfast. However, having this type of quality food, service, and ambiance available at 6am rather than airport food was amazing.  I can sincerely recommend this place and look forward forward to returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing French toast.

E7KXxT7RZ7_nLEpvVc1krA.text: Went here for a date night and the food and drink were wonderful. We ordered the rotisserie chicken family style and everything was delicious. It wasn't as hot as I would've hoped, and there wasn't many vegetables/potatoes so we ate pretty quickly. The food was very good but the price was a little higher for the amount of food we got.   Would go back to try more options though!

8u5xrAvg62JydFxDh-ChyA.text: THE best brunch experience! I enjoyed this place so much. The lighting, the modern decor, the upbeat music, and the friendly staff all put me in a bright mood as soon as I stepped in. Started with the Lot 35 creamy Earl Grey, which had a bit of velvety texture to it, smooth and delicious. Less than 10 minutes later comes the food, I ordered both the French toast and baked egg, yes both for myself. The French Toast was amazing, the thickness of the bread allows me to pour all the maple syrup on top without soggying the the center of the bread, so that you can have both the full flavor of syrup and the fluffiness of bread, all in one bite. If the strawberry on the side was fresh, it would add another layer of refreshing tart to it... but today the strawberry on the side was frozen.  My baked egg was perfect! One bite of sunny-side up egg, with the bold flavor of broccoflower (menu says cauliflower, but the bold flavor points to green cauliflower or "broccoflower"), cream, fresh tomato sauce and a hint of bacon and ham, it hit the spot, just right.

photos.caption: Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French toast

wqiDbhI1PmKfWfPxfzcnog.text: First date night in Pittsburgh and the steaks were high... get it? Second floor, we had the strip...  Anyway, the service at Floor 2 is amazing. Zach was the complete package: both knowledgeable and welcoming. The interior is sophisticated without being stuffy and the views of downtown were great for date night. The menu is great, albeit I've had better similar dishes in more casual restaurants. I recommend skipping the lobster bisque, but the strip was cooked perfectly and had great presentation.

photos.caption: Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bone-in NYStrip and Halibut

_GT02ggIULGSzybFEr_aeQ.text: I stayed at the Fairmont the other night for a business trip and came here for brunch and dinner.  I was surprised during both occasions it was dead as it gets good reviews online.  The eggs and sausage were meh.  The sausage didn't taste great and it was a basic meal.  For dinner I opted for the Caesar Salad and a piece of Salmon.  The salad was tasteless.  I also found the wines to be on the expensive side.  The bar service was decent.  The staff was mostly busy entertaining each other than anything else.  Should I return to the Fairmont I'll opt to dine elsewhere in the area.

jCB_FYgC7RUnmdyACL5NfA.text: Wow -- they do some seriously cool things with their food and the flavors! The staff is awesome and super accommodating. This is a great brunch spot! The decor is also very modern and clean.  Have you seen their French toast?! Each slice is an inch thick, or even more! It's huge but not too heavy and topped generously with powdered sugar and almonds. They also have a lobster Benedict that is huge and very savory. I'm also a fan of their Thai duck wings -- you get a large amount of wings for the price, so the value is great. Any dessert you get here is delicious and they can make tweaks here and there if you ask.   The bar area is really cool and has a great view. Most of the seats and tables also have really good city views and tons of natural light. Cool spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck wings
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French toast

AzCvsguVuCzZF3xwkrEuvw.text: We've been here several times since my last review. I feel the need to mention the service and food we had on our most recent trip though. Our server very confidently claimed that he could feed our entire group of six, family style, with or without wine pairings. All we needed to do was tell him any allergies we had, things we did or didn't like, and anything we'd seen on the menu that we wanted to try. Once this was over we settled in for a memorable and utterly fantastic journey. We ended up with three cold appetizers, three hot appetizers, and the rotisserie chicken, ribeye, and lobster as our main courses. I haven't had such a fun, perfectly paced meal in years! Furthermore when the bill came, I was surprised to see how little damage had been done considering the experience we'd just had. I will continue to come here and bring my out of town guests. Floor 2 is a place you're guaranteed to be satisfied by.

QcaYySXz0SdGK9MwQQCZ4g.text: Each year I am tasked with finding a restaurant for a holiday luncheon for myself and coworkers.  I have wanted to try this place for a while and they accepted our reservation request, so it seemed to be working out.  Just as many have already stated, the inside of this place is gorgeous.  Very clean, sleek and modern looking.    We were seated promptly upon arrival and that is the only prompt thing about this experience.  I didn't expect quick service, but when you wait 10-15 minutes to be greeted by a server and then another 10-15 minutes for your drinks and then another 10 minutes to order food, it is a little much.    The food actually came out more expeditiously than expected, I think it took less time than the ordering process.  I started with a french onion soup that was AMAZINGLY delicious and then followed it with a roast pork sandwich.  The pork sandwich was pretty good, but the soup was definitely the star of the show in my opinion.  It should also be noted that the sandwich came with the largest order of fries I have seen in a long time and they were delicious - crispy shoestring style.  It wasn't a bad and it wasn't great.  Maybe I will give it another try someday down the road.

photos.caption: Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roast Pork sandwich from the lunch menu
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ginormous side of fries that came with my sandwich
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French Onion Soup

nWrre_3hROaCdiXY0xJxKA.text: My first couple of visits to Floor 2 were only for drinks and appetizers at the bar.  My friends and I were pleasantly surprised by the inventive flavor combinations of their vegetarian appetizers and cocktails. Which enticed us to come here for brunch. Brunch was so enjoyable from the atmosphere and service to the food, we ended up coming back for brunch again the following month! I recommend the French Toast. I only made reservations on a Saturday at noon because we are a 6-person group and wanted to make sure the restaurant was ready for us. But there were plenty of open seats at the bar and smaller tables for walk-ins when we were there. There are options at various price points and in my opinion it is worth the price paid. Street parking is free near the hotel on Sundays and there's always valet if you can't find nearby metered street parking.

Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Entry stairs
Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast sandwich

i2V5riuLb6ZPd6Q0omB3ZA.text: My partner and I came here to celebrate my Birthday. We loved the vibe the restaurant had. The gold light fixtures with woods and metals. Like a hardware restoration store feeling.  We started off with the mussels. Huge portion of delicious mussels, and broth that was so flavorful. We also wanted to try the kampachi which was pretty good. We loved the soy sauce it came in.  For the main course, we saw some one get the cast iron ribeye (28oz). Best decision all night. Ask for more of the Au Jus sauce (BORDELAISE). That was incredible with the onion jam. Me and my partner are still talking about how amazing the sauce and the onion jam were with that perfectly cooked meat.  Loved it here, cant wait to come back for dessert. We were way to full.   The only thing I would say is the menu is small, and the prices online are different than what the prices are in the restaurant, however only off by like 2 bucks.

photos.caption: Photo of Floor 2 - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 28 oz ribeye
